prob140 tutorial!¶

This is a brief introduction to the functionality in prob140! For an interactive guide, see the examples notebook in the GitLab directory.

Table of Contents

  • Getting Started
  • Creating a Distribution
  • Events
  • Utilities
  • Plotting

Getting Started¶

Make sure you are on the most recent version of the prob140 library. See the installation guide for more directions.

If you are using an iPython notebook, use this as your first cell:

# HIDDEN

import matplotlib
from datascience import *
from prob140 import *
%matplotlib inline
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')

Creating a Distribution¶

The prob140 library adds distribution methods to the default table class that you should already be familiar with. A distribution is defined as a 2-column table in which the first column represents the domain of the distribution while the second column represents the probabilities associated with each value in the domain.

You can specify a list or array to the methods domain and probability to specify those columns for a distribution

In [1]: from prob140 import *

In [2]: dist1 = Table().domain(make_array(2, 3, 4)).probability(make_array(0.25, 0.5, 0.25))

In [3]: print(dist1)
Value | Probability
2     | 0.25
3     | 0.5
4     | 0.25

We can also construct a distribution by explicitly assigning values for the domain but applying a probability function to the values of the domain

In [4]: dist2 = Table().domain(np.arange(1, 8, 2)).probability_function(lambda x: 1/4)

In [5]: print(dist2)
Value | Probability
1     | 0.25
3     | 0.25
5     | 0.25
7     | 0.25

This can be very useful when we have a distribution with a known probability density function, such as the binomial distribution

In [6]: from scipy.misc import comb

In [7]: def pmf(x):
   ...:     n = 10
   ...:     p = 0.3
   ...:     return comb(n,x) * p**x * (1-p)**(n-x)
   ...: 

In [8]: binomial = Table().domain(np.arange(11)).probability_function(pmf)

In [9]: print(binomial)
Value | Probability
0     | 0.0282475
1     | 0.121061
2     | 0.233474
3     | 0.266828
4     | 0.200121
5     | 0.102919
6     | 0.0367569
7     | 0.00900169
8     | 0.0014467
9     | 0.000137781
... (1 rows omitted)
